findings.title: Mint Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens, which can lead to token inflation.

findings.title: Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions.

findings.title: Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments that can lead to issues like gas efficiency and complexity.

findings.title: Redundant Code Statements
findings.description: The contract has redundant code segments that can be optimized for size, memory consumption, and execution speed.

findings.title: State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant to ensure that their values cannot be changed.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not follow Solidity naming conventions, which can lead to readability and maintainability issues.

findings.title: Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is declared in the contract.

findings.title: Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: The contract is missing events that can notify external parties about changes or actions within the contract.

findings.title: Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: The contract uses assembly, which can be error-prone and difficult to read and understand.

findings.title: Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The contract's pragma version lock is not stable, which can lead to compatibility issues with different compiler versions.
